bow: mommy wars cloth diapers vs disposables what are your thoughts cloth diapers are amazing at preventing poopsplosion and disposables seem to hold pee better just my opinion defo cloth disposable have been linked to some health problems such as future infertility only used organic cloth dipers cloth diapers but only if you do mind doing laundry every day and for me inserts and pockets are infinitely better than prefolds with covers can you link to source for this love to do cloth but as mom working full time just do feel like have the time for the extra work either is fine just have to weigh your situation we dont have have to walk to the laundry facility and its coin operated cloth diaper services in our area are expensive disposables were much cheaper deal for us ve done it all thought would hate cloth but did at all and was sorry did start sooner saw huge savings do think that your life has to be somewhat normal and organized we had family medical emergency and were visiting the hospital almost daily while taking care of kids for quite few months and cloth diapering became overwhelming thought would hate it and we have ended up loving it think one of the big things for us though is that we never purchased disposables so we do know what it like doing it the other way if we had started in disposables and then tried to make the transition to cloth it might have been harder to adopt cloth think it really really helps that husband is 100 on board with it and in the couple of times have told him that was just going to go buy disposables when we were short on cloth he reminded me that is the point and encouraged me to just be patient deleted did cloth from birth until now months and liked it but then work picked up and kiddo started daycare where they only do disposables even with big stash of cloth diapers was getting behind on the laundry and disposables started being worth the price of convenience still break my cloth out on the weekends to keep the price of disposables down bit love my cloth my son has had diarrhea for the past few weeks probably stress we just moved and we had to go to sposies bc it was just impossible with cloth we miss our cloth now it looks like dude is starting to feel better so we are excited to go back to our normal ca believe how much you have to buy when you use sposies it would be great of you sourced your reference as far as am aware this claim is untrue if there are studies on this would love to read them use cloth but if my mom or anyone else is watching the baby send disposables it not big deal to me do care what diapers other people use happy with cloth because it cheaper better for the environment and not that difficult now that ve gotten the hang of it seriously question that sposies have been around for at least couple of generations was in sposies and my kid can tell you fertility has never been an issue gah why does it have to be war use both and do care what anyone else does we used cloth pockets for little over year until the leaks became too much to handle skinny thighed butt scooting heavy wetter pee squished out with every movement then we switched to disposables while trying out some different cloth options now we do cloth at home ai2s with double gussets and disposables on the go at night and everything fine before our son was born we bought fuck of lot of cloth nappies to use then he was born they make great dish towels think mommy wars are stupid as long as it not hurting your child really do care how you choose to diaper personally prefer disposable because already doing upwards of loads of laundry week for my husband son and and do want to take any more time away from family time to do chores did cloth working ft it funny hate laundry too but for some reason just got in routine and the cloth worked glad we did it though it totally is not for everyone there are pros and cons to either option and the first to say that cloth are not necessarily as environmentally friendly as some like to say it is water usage modern materials like pul nylon are petroleum based stuff like that it largely just comes down to personal preference for me it was just that could stand the huge amounts of garbage those bags are so heavy that disposables produced and cloth was cute and saved some money though not as much as some proponents tell people did disposable cloth was just not an option for me the cost of getting into was way to high plus no washing machine in my apartment the cost of starting is extremely prohibitive take that with grain of salt as my kid was not planned and was and still nearly am dirt poor love her to death but its been rough road financially did disposables with my first my second we cloth diapered because we were super super poor and were sure about how our money situation would be glad we did since it been amazing for us it not for everyone it saved us ton of money though which we desperately needed we did cloth during the day but never could figure out good night time system for them so we did disposables overnight feel like got the best of both worlds that way great balance may ask why cloth is impossible with diarrhea so many of the things cared about or had really strong opinions about when was pregnant or when my daughter was under one have just simply lost their importance as she gets older as soon as we started planning baby number two knew would care about any of these things anymore am eternally grateful for this shift so much less stress what ai2s do you use use both cloth at home when have the energy disposables when out and about love being able to save when we need to but laundry can be burden for sure feel like better mom when use cloth because cloth diapers seem more luxurious and they require more work if the house is chaotic ll use more disposables cause ca even think about having to do laundry do have washer dryer in unit overall cloth diapers seem more special and more fun but def more work too at the risk of asking dumb question are there any earth friendly disposable options cloth diapering is plausible option for me tried when my oldest was baby but that was about years ago have any good options come around since then it will spray everywhere everywhere yup seventh generation makes some good ones exactly we do cloth during the day and disposable at night or if we re traveling and it works great and saves ton of money we love our system we do the same love it honest company diapers are great eco friendly option you can buy them online or at target and the patterns are so stinking cute this is the brand was planning on using until decided on cloth depends on the diaper style we use fitteds with covers and we almost never have poo breach anytime we ve used disposables for travel though we get at least one up the back mess this is one of the areas of parenting where do quite understand why there would be war parents should use whatever kind of diaper works best for their child the epa estimates it can take 200 years for disposable diaper to decompose and the number of diapers you ll throw into landfill has got to make you question if your time spent doing laundry worth the harm society contributes to the earth much less the other compelling reasons towards cd like cost ease of access do have to run to the store use for future children all natural more absorbent and heavy duty cuter etc in my house we value our time lower than other people so that just personal preference there laundry to me is big deal few other comments would suggest prefolds combined with thirsties covers and snappies for your collection pockets are not as reliable and are more expensive prefolds are also easier to keep ammonia free if you are set
